intro: Aeschynanthus deleiensis, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces vibrant orange to yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a mist of blossoms. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Aeschynanthus deleiensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and prolonged flowering period.
